text: Jan Jansz. Starter (1593 – 1626) was a poet from the Northern Netherlands. Starter was born in Amsterdam and became a prolific writer, whose poems were set to melody in his lifetime. He died young in battle. Many of his poems became the subject of other artworks such as plays or paintings. He is best known for his poem about the "Mennonite Sister". File:JJ Starter in Friesche Lusthof.jpg|engraving of Starter for the title page of his Friesche Lusthof, by Jan van de Velde == References == * Starter in the French National Biography database Category:1593 births Category:1626 deaths Category:Writers from Amsterdam Category:17th-century Dutch poets Category:Dutch male poets Category:17th-century male writers
title: Jan Janszoon Starter
